definition: to treat with contempt or ridicule : deride
examples: he has been mocked as a mama's boy
for any government to mock men's hopes with mere words and promises and gestures
the unstable, strange new world of subatomic particles that mock all attempts at understanding

definition: to imitate (someone or something) closely : mimic
examples: a mockingbird was mocking a cardinal

definition: to mimic in sport or derision
examples: followed the old man along the street mocking his gait
she … mocked at his piety as affectation

definition: an act of ridicule or derision : jeer
one that is an object of derision or scorn
of, relating to, or having the character of an imitation : simulated, feigned
examples: the mock solemnity of the parody

definition: in an insincere or counterfeit manner
